AttributeWriteId<String>

    public class ComboBox
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.TextBox
implements AttributeWriteDataList, AttributeWriteHtmlId
    A ComboBox is a TextBox combined with a DataList that allows to choose from predefined options.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • getId

        public String getId()
        This method gets the unique identifier of this object.
        ATTENTION:
        In order to be compliant with all possible UI toolkit implementations, a valid ID has to fulfill ECMA-262, Section 7.6. It is recommended to use IDs of the form [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_$]*. Invalid IDs (e.g. containing colon, hash or period) are not accepted to prevent you from later having problems with CSS selectors.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface AttributeReadHtmlId
        Specified by:
        getId in interface AttributeReadId<String>
        Returns:
        the ID of this object.
        See Also:
        AttributeReadHtmlId.ID_SEPARATOR

      • setId

        public void setId(String id)
        This method set the ID of this object. Use this method to give the object a meaningful identifier after creation.
        ATTENTION:
        See javadoc of AttributeReadHtmlId.getId() for the syntax constraints of IDs.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
